data.name: 7 Wonders Science Scorer
data.description:
In the board game 7 Wonders one of the ways to get victory points is through aquiring science buildings.
Each science building you acquire has one of the following 3 symbols on it:

* Compass (C)
* Gear (G)
* Tablet (T)


Each distinct set of a Compass, a gear, and a tablet scores 7 points.
In addition to this, for each symbol you score the square of the number of buildings you have of that symbol. 
     
    For example, if you have 4 compasses, 3 gears, and 2 tablets you would have 2 sets and your score 
    would be calculated as follows:
        Compass     - Gear      - Tablet    -> 7 pts
        Compass     - Gear      - Tablet    -> 7 pts
        Compass     - Gear          |
        Compass         |           |
            |           |           |
        16 pts        9 pts       4 pts
     The total would therefore be: 7 + 7 + 16 + 9 + 4 = 43 pts
      
In addition to the above, some science buildings have a 'wild' symbol (W) instead. At the end the game the wild symbol counts as whichever symbol (C,G, or T) would maximise the score.
     
     For example, if you acquire a gear, a tablet and a wild symbol, you would let the wild symbol 
     count as a compass to complete the set and score 10 points:
        Gear        - Tablet    = Wild (Compass) -> 7 pts
          |             |           |
         1 pt          1 pt        1 pt
     
To complete this kata you need to calculate the maximum score given a set of symbols, which are represented by a string of characters.
For example, 3 cogs, 2 gears, a tablet, and a wild would be represented by "CCCGGTW". 

You can assume the input to be uppercase and can ignore the possibility of any other symbols in the string. The symbols can be specified in any order. 
The solution should allow for any number of symbols (including any number of wild symbols).
